intro: Piscidia guaricensis, commonly known as the Guariçense trumpet tree, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as a tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive trumpet-shaped corolla. The species is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
